Description: Shoulder and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, probably a neck-amphora or possibly a oinochoe; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of bull (only head remaining), to right with vines consisting of dot leaves and bunches of grapes, in field; at far left, part of undetermined motif with added white.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the subject matter, see the neck-amphora Louvre F255 (Beazley Archive 10875; Pottier, E., CVA Paris, Louvre, 4, France 5, 1928, pl. 218, no, 1, no, 4-6.)
The object to left is likely to be part of a maenad.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0040) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
